docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Cerbo GX Setup
docs.text:
1. Power Up the Cerbo GX: Ensure the device is properly connected to a stable power source.
  2. Connect to VictronConnect App:
  3. Use Wi-Fi or Bluetooth to connect.
  4. If using Bluetooth, pair the Cerbo GX using its displayed Bluetooth PIN.
  5. Configure Network Connection:
  6. In VictronConnect, navigate to Settings > Networks.
  7. Connect the Cerbo GX to the same Wi-Fi network as your setup device.
  8. Register on VRM Portal:
  9. Access the online VRM portal and add a new installation by entering the VRM ID (found on the Cerbo GX).
  10. Set Date and Time:
  11. Navigate to Settings > Date and Time and configure the system to the correct time zone.
  12. Set the Location:
  13. Navigate to Settings > Location and save the site location.
  14. Grant Access:
  15. Navigate to Settings > Users and connect Cerbo to VRM, then share full site access with remote@differcommunitypower.com.

docs.title: Depth Sensor Setup
docs.text:
1. Connect the Sensor to RS485 Device:
  2. The GLT500 Depth Sensor has four wires:
    • Yellow: Connect to the A+ terminal of the RS485 interface.
    • Blue: Connect to the B- terminal of the RS485 interface.
  3. Power the Sensor:
  4. Red (Power): Connect to the positive (+) terminal of a 12V DC power supply or battery.
  5. Green (Ground): Connect to the negative (-) terminal of the power supply or battery.
  6. Plug the RS485-to-USB converter into one of the USB ports on the Cerbo GX.
  7. Verify Data on VRM:
  8. Ensure the Cerbo GX Setup Helper is active.
  9. The sensor should automatically begin transmitting data to the VRM portal for monitoring.

docs.title: Flow Sensor Setup
docs.text:
1. Identify the I/O Port on the Cerbo GX.
  2. Wire the Sensor:
  3. The YF-S201 water flow sensor has three wires:
    • Red: Power (connect to +ve terminal of 12V power supply - battery).
    • Black: Ground (connect to the common GND from Cerbo and -ve from the battery).
    • Yellow: Signal (connect to one of the digital I/O pins on the Cerbo GX).
  4. In the Remote Console, navigate to Settings > I/O > Inputs.
  5. Locate the input number corresponding to the I/O port you connected the sensor to.
  6. Set the input type to Pulse Meter.
  7. Navigate to the Home Page of the Remote Console interface on the Cerbo GX and select the Pulse Meter configuration option.
  8. Set Up and Calibrate the Sensor:
  9. Reset the pulse counter.
  10. Set the initial multiplier to 1 for preliminary calibration.
  11. Allow water to flow through the sensor into a calibrated container (e.g., a 20-liter vessel).
  12. Monitor and note the total pulse count recorded by the system once the container is filled.
  13. Calculate the Multiplier: Multiplier = Container Volume (liters) / Pulse Count.
  14. Update the Pulse Meter settings with the calculated multiplier value to ensure accurate flow measurement.

docs.title: GX LTE 4G Setup
docs.text:
1. Mount the device in a place that is not covered by metal objects.
  2. Mount the included antenna to the SMA connector labeled LTE.
  3. Insert the SIM card.
  4. Connect the GX LTE 4G to the Cerbo GX with the supplied USB cable.
  5. Connect the modem to a DC power supply (battery).
  6. After power-up, the blue LED will be solid blue. Once it has registered on a network, the LED will blink slowly. When the internet connection is established, the LED will blink quickly.
  7. For VRM configuration of GX LTE 4G, follow this link.

docs.title: Teltonika Setup
docs.text:
1. Take a picture of Teltonika Serial and Cerbo VRM ID.
  2. Insert SIM card into Teltonika Modem.
  3. Start Teltonika:
  4. Login refer to the Teltonika printout or request IT for the password.
  5. If BOS has a setup, request the PW from IT. If BOS has not set PW, complete the wizard and set admin password (request from IT).
  6. Activate auto reboot/ping reboot. Set to reboot after 60 minutes of failure.
  7. Check that the internet works by browsing to a URL.
  8. Ensure Cerbo is connected to the Teltonika LAN port and has obtained an IP address.
  9. Activate the reboot on Cerbo (as usual).

docs.title: Program Setup
docs.text:
1. Enable Superuser Access:
  2. Go to Remote Console > Settings > General > Access Level.
  3. Hold the right arrow for five seconds to unlock superuser access (password: set secure password), then activate remote access, link: root_access.
  4. Retrieve IP Address:
  5. In Remote Console > Settings > Wi-Fi, find and copy the IP address.
  6. Access via SSH:
  7. Log into the Cerbo GX using SSH: ssh root@<IP address>.
